runs.comm: almost a mix-up between the two. Kallis had pushed towards cover, took one step out, Smith rushed across but Kallis sent him back quickly
shout for lbw but it was missing leg stump. It cut back in, full length delivery and hit him on the pad.
And gets this one to straighten out and Kallis is beaten, driving inside the line. Kallis goes to have a close look at the pitch
Classy cover drive. Everything right about it. The left elbow, the front leg and the bat-swing. Superbly struck.
it was in the slot for another cover drive but Kallis went too hard this time, the bat-face shut and the ball rolled back to the bowler
back of length and outside off, moving away but Kallis wrists it close on the leg side for a single
136 kmph full delivery well outside off stump and Kallis lashes it well clear of the backward point. Afridi rushes to have a chat with the young bowler
length delivery, angling across Kallis who steers it to backward point. Smith shouts, 'Wait! Wait"
edged through the vacant slip region. The slip had just moved out after the earlier four. It was angling away from Kallis who went for the big square drive and the ball flashed to the boundary
full pitched around off stump, very well struck cover drive and Fawad leaps to his right to stop it. Slip moves back in now.
Another fluent cover drive but can't pierce the field. Kallis shuffled a touch before driving to cover
shuffles to the off stump and flicks the full delivery on the off and middle past square leg for couple of runs.
Smith gets a boundary off the first ball he faced. Poor delivery. With short fine-leg in, Razzaq slipped down leg and Smith accepts the gift with a fine glance
walks couple of steps down the track, Razzaq drags back the length and Smith taps it gently on the off side and calls Kallis for a quick single
short in length, clipped towards square leg, kallis says 'Two two two' but the fielder rushes in to prevent the second run
full in length, on the middle, deflected to midwicket

Four byes! It was a very good delivery. It cut past Smith who was squared up completely and the ball goes to left of Akmal who was tending to move to his right. He lunged to his left with the outstretched left glove but couldn't stop. Nasser Hussain drawls on air, " I particularly don't like wicket keepers with sunglasses on."
lands outside leg stump, moves in to get past the prod and strike the pad high
fullish, on the middle and leg, whipped past square leg
on the middle stump line, he was looking to play towards mid-on and with his bat-grip and the way the he holds his bat, the ball deflected towards midwicket
stays back to clip it off his hips
again, shuffles towards off, tries to work the ball from outside off to the on side for a single but ends up jabbing it back to the bowler.
And again. He moves towards off to tickle it to short fine-leg
143.4 kmph short of length delivery bouncing over middle stump, Smith decides late to go for the pull and doesn't connect. Akmal gathers.
short in length, cutting in to cramp Kallis who crouches to stab it away to the off side
Kallis tries to make use of that field by walking outside off but Razzaq pushed it further outside off, dabbed to the off side

dropped by Gul at mid-off. Smith went for the big ugly pull and top-edged it high over mid-off. Gul moved to his right but misjudged it completely, tried to back-pedal in the end but didn't get a hand on it. That should have been caught. And what's more he fell awkwardly on his back side and his head banged against the ground. Ouch. He is getting some attention.

short in length, coming in from outside leg stump, Smith was down the track, tried to whip it away and the ball fell the on side after crashing into his thigh pad. Smith wasn't sure about the single but Kallis was.
A very fine on-drive from Kallis. He, again, moved towards the off side and wristed the on drive past the non-striker. Fine piece of timing.
Again, that movement to outside-off, Razzaq takes it outside off, chopped through gully
130.6 kmph length delivery, off cutter, cutting across Kallis who is opened-up completely and the ball bounces through to Akmal
walks towards off, no midwicket in place, works it to backward square leg for a single
dances down the track, fires a yorker on the off stump, squeezed to backward point. Smith looks closely at the bottom of his bat where he made contact
another yorker on the middle stump, dug out back to the bowler.
Two fine yorkers followed by a short-pitched delivery. Smith, looking increasingly restless there, goes for the big pull and edges it straight up. The bowler himself comes under it.
No slip but a short third man in. The slow off cutter has Kallis searching for the ball outside off stump, it bounces once before it reaches Akmal
Gibbs starts off with a very fluent cover drive. It was floated outside off stump, Gibb stretched across to drive it well clear of the sweeper cover
around the off stump, steered to backward point
on the leg and middle, straightening a touch, tapped to vacant midwicket and Afridi rushes after the ball
turn and bounce there. It spun away from Kallis who tries to adjust to the turn by trying to steer it to point but is beaten
worked past square leg for a single

Afridi cleans up Gibbs with a lovely slider. It landed on the off stump line and skidded on. Gibbs pushed at it, playing for the leg break, the bat outside the line and heard the death rattle. Afridi points his right index finger to the skies and stands proudly in celebration.
turns in from outside off, Kallis goes back to nudge it to backward square leg
on the off stump line, full, defended to the on side of the pitch
leans forward to on drive the flighted off break to long-on
on the off and middle, straightening, Kallis was playing for the off break and adjusts in the end to the doosra to stab it to the off side.
goes right back to carefully push it to the off side
flighted outside off stump and de Villiers gets forward to defend
on the off stump line, driven to sweeper cover
dropped by Akmal. Lovely ripping leg break turning from the off stump line, AB pushed hard at it, got the thick edge and Akmal couldn't hold on to slightly difficult chance

But Afridi gets his man now. Again that skidder, this time from short of length, luring AB into a cut shot. Fatal. The ball clipped the inner edge and fell on the stumps. Gone! What a strike from Afridi. And the wheels turn.
short in length on the middle and leg and moves towards off and middle, defended to the off side
goes right back to push to cover point
leg break on the middle and leg line, dabbed to square leg. A fine wicket-taking over from Afridi comes to an end. The crowd roar as he takes the cap from the umpire.
Kallis keeps the fight going. It was slightly short, turning in, and Kallis rocked back to pull it high over midwicket
flighted full on the middle and leg, Kallis was on the shuffle and wristed it past square leg
from round the stumps now, flighted full on the off stump line, Duminy paddles it to fine-leg
tossed full around off stump, slower in the air, steered to backward point
a tad quicker, flatter as well, pushed to cover for a single
the doosra on the off stump line, Kallis read it and guided it to left of Gul at short third man for a single
the quicker one, on the middle stump, defended back to Afridi
slower, fuller, driven to left of Afridi who dives but can't stop it cleanly
short in length, outside off stump, cut to Misbah at cover
flighed leg break on the middle and off, Duminy almost pushed outside the line and edged it to the on side of the pitch
slows it up, flights it higher, fuller, flicked for a single
quicker slider on the middle and off, punched towards extra cover for a single
flighted full just outside off stump, driven past the non-striker
on the off stump line, cut to right of cover where Younis makes a sliding stop
arm-ball on the middle stump, makes room by moving to the leg side before chopping it to backward point
bit more air, fuller and on the middle, whipped to deep midwicket
off break coming in from outside off, tapped to left of short third man for a single
leans across to wrist it against the turn to right of deep midwicket for couple of runs
quicker one, around off stump, guided to backward poitn
quickish, just outside off stump, tapped to short third man region. Shahzaib was the fielder and Younis suggests that he should release the ball quicker. Shahzaib nods.
shout for a catch behind but Kallis jabbed his bat on to his pad and the ball went past the outside edge
this one almost squeezed through the bat and pad gap, jabbed away in the end
steered to backward point region
flighted around the leg stump, reverse swept to midwicket region. And Afridi's potentially match-winning spell comes to an end. The crowd show their appreciation for his effort.
goes for the yorker straightaway but slips out as a full toss down the leg side
Again down the leg side and this time Duminy glances it away fine, past the diving Akmal
length delivery on the leg stump line, tries to clip it away, misses and is struck high on the pad

full, very full, around the leg stump, Duminy tries to whip it away, misses and is struck on the pad. Loud shout for lbw. The hawk eye suggests it pitched on the leg stump line and would have clipped the leg stump.
gets it to straighten outside off stump, Kallis tries to follow the leg cutter and is beaten. His feet were all over the place there.
another leg cutter in the outside-off channel, Kallis doesn't move his feet, tries to stand and deliver on the up and is beaten again.
fuller and Kallis unfurls his extra-cover drive. He leaned into it to knife it through the off-side for a fine boundary
the left-arm spinner starts off with a full delivery on the leg and middle, swung away to deep square leg
short in length, quicker, Kallis rocks back to lift it to left of long-on
skids outside off stump, full, chopped away to cover for another single
runs down the track and drags it to wide long-on boundary. fifty up for Kallis. Lone man standing so far. So much depends on him .
He is going after Fawad. He charged down the track, got under the ball and heaved it high over long-on boundary.
quicker, skidding from short of length, punched to wide midwicket region for couple of runs. A very good over for SA.
from round the stumps, floated on the leg stump line, tries the reverse sweep but doesn't connect.
spins towards pads, clipped for a single
whipped through to deep midwicket region
doosra on the middle stump, Kallis adjusts to tap it to the on side
fires it really quick on the off stump line, Duminy goes for the big hit, ends up edging slicing it  towards long-on but it falls safely
fires it in full, drilled to left of long-off where Malik does superbly well to rush across, swoop on the ball and release it quickly off balance to prevent the extra run.
the yorker arrives on the base of the middle stump, dug out to the on side, wants a run but kills that thought as Gul rushes forward and under-arms a direct hit. It's referred upstairs. Not out.
moves outside leg stump, has a slog, misses but will pick a leg bye as the ball rolls to short third man
another fab yorker, Kallis can only squeeze it to the off side. Gul himself goes to pick the ball. Late reverse swing on.
What a bowler. Another great yorker on the middle, dug out to the on side.
full and outside off stump, Kallis goes for the big square drive, edges it to left of third man where Ajmal makes a super stop diving to his left. The fielders applaud, the crowd roar.
Under pressure, he keeps hurling those yorkers in. Thrilling stuff. Another inswinging delivery, stabbed to the on side.

The big fish is caught. Jacques Kallis is gone. He moved outside leg stump and went for the big lofted hit over long-on against the doosra.. He got more elevation than distance though. The ball seemed to hang on up for an eternity before swirling down at long-on. Waiting below was Malik who took it. A fine innings but he is gone now.
rushes down the track, Ajmal pushes it well outside off, dragged to long-on
from round the stumps, fires it in really quickly, skids past the prod to hit the pad. Going down leg, though.
Duminy gets himself some breathing space with a slog sweep to the cowcorner. It was the quick low full toss and duminy swung it wide of deep midwicket
slower, skids on, Duminy goes for big heave, the great big slog, but misses it completely but the ball bounds off the pad to third man boundary. Razzaq gave chase but couldn't haul the ball back in.
another big swing to the on side attempted, again bat meets air and the ball hits the pad and rolls away.
low full toss on the off stump, mistimes the hit to extra cover
moves outside leg stump and Gul fires another yorker , the bat comes down but can't connect properly
full and fast, Albie swings his bat, no wood on leather, and the ball bounds off the pad to Akmal but they rush across
Not quite the yorker this time, but pretty full and straight, driven hard but Malik intercepts at long-on
What do you when the bowler fires in yorker after yorker. Again and again. Great bowling this. Stabbed  to the on side for a single

just short of the blockhole but pretty much there almost, on the middle stump, driven to long-off. What a terrific spell from Gul. It was a delight to watch him  bowl those yorkers under such high pressure.
139.2 kmph length delivery outside off stump, Duminy has a big swing and a miss. Smith looks on expressionless from the dug out. Albie gets across to have a chat with Duminy.
Duminy swings and connects. Full toss on the leg and middle and he killed it over square leg. Kepler Wessels has hope: " difficult but not impossible"
fires it full, falls short of yorker length, driven to long-off and they turn for the second run. Albie runs quickly but Fawad Alam is quicker with his throw. Direct hit and Albie is short.
full and straight again, driven hard to Fawad who fires it to the bowler who doesn't collect cleanly and misses the stumps. The rest of the fielders jump in agony. 14 from 2 balls.
Duminy is connecting with his big hits in this over. Too late, though. It was a dipping full toss and he swung it hard to wide long-on boundary.

And Pakistan move to the Twenty20 World Cup final. The final ball has been hit to long-off. The fielders jump up and down. The crowd roar and roar. In the middle, Pakistan players hug each other. The South African players look shell shocked in the dug out. Afridi, Malik walk back with a laugh. Morose sad faces in the other dug out. Joy and sorrow collide. The two teams shake hands with each other.
